Manages daily network operations, ensuring the Data Center and Enterprise networks are functioning at peak performance. Assists team members in developing new solutions as well as troubleshooting network and security issues. Implements new network and security products and creates processes for utilizing new technology to enhance the capabilities and efficiencies of managing the network and security infrastructure. Design local and wide area networks and maintains communication links, cables and devices. Manage Software Defined Network Environment. Manage Enterprise Network Management tool. Manages project to implement and/or enhance local and wide area network infrastructure. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES: Comprehensive knowledge of networking and telecommunications technologies; Extensive Routers and Switch experience, specific to Cisco and Nexus hardware; Ability to manage firewalls(Cisco or Palo Alto); Ability to work independently or as a team member to identify requirements, find and evaluate alternatives, present solutions, make recommendations and follow projects through to completion; Ability to take initiative and use creative and innovative thinking to find solutions to business problems; Ability to serve as a team leader, providing coordination and leadership to other team members; Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with users, peers and department officials; Ability to provide technical training to co-workers; Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing. MINIMUM EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS: Any combination of education and experience equivalent to graduation from an accredited college or university with a bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field, with a demonstrated ability to design, implement, and troubleshoot local and wide area networks. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: Project Management and leadership experience is desired. Technical certification highly desirable (e.g. CNA, CNE, etc.). Summary Yes, this is government, but we'll surprise you in how we break from the stereotypical mold. King County is driving to become the best run government in the country. For King County Department of Information Technology (KCIT) that means pushing the County forward through innovation and optimization. We're committed to helping our customers and our constituents get solutions that help them do their job or do life easier. That's where you come in. KCIT is seeking multiple Senior Network Engineers. The Senior Network Engineer is a highly skilled and experienced IT professional responsible for the implementation, maintenance, and monitoring of the company's network infrastructure. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of networking concepts and technologies, as well as strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills. King County Department of Information Technology (KCIT) KCIT provides the building blocks for many of our region's most critical services. As a business solutions partner, we collaborate with 18 other King County departments to develop products and services that better serve the needs of our customers and our community. Visit kingcounty.gov/kcit to learn more. KCIT was recently recognized for its vision, strategy, innovation, and collaboration as the first-place recipient in the 15th annual Digital Counties Survey. In the past 11 years, KCIT has also earned multiple top 10 Digital County honors from the Center for Digital Government. With a record of success, KCIT focuses on delivering smart technology solutions and innovative information technology to support customers building stronger communities. Teleworking Requirement The work associated with this position will be performed through a combination of onsite work and teleworking as needed. Employees will have access to shared workspaces at various King County facilities. Employees must reside in Washington state and within a reasonable distance to their King County worksite to respond to workplace reporting requirements. Employees will be provided with a County issued laptop and must maintain a workspace with an internet connection (access may be supplemented in some situations) where they can reliably perform work and remain available and responsive during scheduled work hours. King County has a robust collection of tools and resources to support working remotely. The individual selected for this opportunity will be joining an innovative and progressive team that is redefining how we work in this department's hybrid environment. Duration These positions are estimated for a duration of two years. Benefits King County offers a robust benefits package to support you and your family in a variety of ways. To learn more about the benefits offered here, please click on the Benefits tab or click here: http://www.kingcounty.gov/employees/. Work Schedule The normal workweek for this position is Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. but may require after hours work as needed. Alternative work schedules may be considered. This position is not eligible for overtime pay. Questions If you have questions regarding this recruitment, please contact shdickson@kingcounty.gov, or 206-253-2454. Job Duties Senior Network Engineers are highly skilled and experienced IT professionals responsible for the implementation, maintenance, and monitoring of the company's network infrastructure. Ideal candidates will have a deep understanding of networking concepts and technologies, as well as strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills. Perform operational and administrative functions to ensure continuous operations of enterprise systems by performing monitoring of systems, applications and networks, using tools for verification of services, and detecting, reporting, escalating, and correlating events to determine customer impact and document anomalies according to established procedures. Provide technical support and troubleshooting for IT incidents, service requests, and computer operations management, this position will evaluate, prioritize, correlate alerts and events, document and triage IT incidents to respond promptly and proactivity to minimize end-user impact. Provide technical leadership and mentoring to journey-level engineers. Plan, implement and maintain upgrades/updates/fixes for core operating systems and their related components following industry best practices, without negative impact to the overall availability and reliability of the enterprise systems/networks. Act as the liaison between vendors, technical support hot lines and departments to resolve complex systems or network problems. Perform troubleshooting of network routers, switches and other endpoint devices to establish connectivity and existing tools according to established procedures. Perform the installation, removal and positioning of computer equipment and cabling in the Data Center; ensure availability of resources required to add new equipment. Respond to customer requests for equipment adds/moves/changes. Perform space planning and installation for servers and related equipment. Electrical audit and planning. Create standard operating procedures and technical documentation for assigned systems. Assist with leading the testing of services after change management is implemented. Assist with physical security measures, such as performing security audits. Provide a high level of professional, quality customer service at all times. Enter requests utilizing the IT Service Center ticketing system and evaluate, categorize and prioritize requests. Document and enter actions taken and decisions made. Refer tickets to other analyst groups and subject matter experts. Follow security processes and understand how they apply to this role. Ability to communicate instructions and information effectively in a manner appropriate to the technical knowledge of the audience. Ability to promote and follow county business policies and procedures, county IT policies, standards and guidelines, and IT Service Center goals and objectives. Strong written and oral communication skills including strong interpersonal skills, with a focus on relationship building, listening, and questioning skills. Strong computer troubleshooting, analysis, research, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail. Perform other duties as assigned. Experience, Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field. 5 years of experience in a network engineering or IT support role. Strong knowledge of networking concepts and technologies. Experience with network troubleshooting and problem solving. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines. Ability to establish and maintain effective relationships with customers, gaining their trust and respect. Excellent written communication skills. Demonstrated ability to correspond verbally and in writing to customers and coworkers at all levels. Ability to clearly articulate technical issues to a wide audience and maintain procedural documentation. Ability to prioritize customer-reported issues, recognizing critical issues and anticipating and adjusting for problems and roadblocks. Manages the work and sets priorities in a well-planned and organized manner. Skilled in handling multiple competing priorities, using time effectively and efficiently. Valid Washington State Driver’s License or ability to obtain one Perform other duties as assigned. Desirable Experience 5-years or more experience in an IT role, performing the administration and maintenance of enterprise network systems according to established industry best practices with the customers in mind. 3-years or more experience implementing enterprise networks including wide area and local area network technologies. 2-years or more experience in current configuration management of Cisco routers, Cisco switches, and security tools and appliances. At least 1-year experience in reading and interpreting architectural designs, technical specifications and other technical documents. At least 1-year experience in current engineering and monitoring tools. ITIL Foundation Certification Microsoft Certification Network certifications (CCNA, CCNP, CCIE, CISSP) or equivalent experience Supplemental Information Forbes named King County as one of Washington State's best employers. Overview: The Sr. Network Engineer's primary task is the planning, configuration, installation, systems management, and coordination of the enterprise WLANs/LANs/MANs/WANs (may include local, metropolitan, and wide area networks) to meet defined business objectives. You will be required to collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders in planning, implementing and supporting technical projects and for operational support of large production EDW platforms ensuring optimal network throughput and availability. This position requires that you be available outside of normal business hours on an as-needed basis when required. Responsibilities: Act as lead for deploying, configuring and monitoring network equipment, network usage and systems availability. Designing, implementing and supporting LAN/WAN architectures including routers, switches (L2/L3); common network services (DNS, DHCP, HTTP, FTP, SNMP, SMTP, Exchange, etc.); directory services (Active Directory, LDAP); network protocols (TCP/IP); routing protocols (HSRP, EIGRP, BGP, etc.); security (firewalls, NAT, intrusion detection, content filtering, anti-virus measures, etc.); remote access (VPN, dialup strategies). Collect and analyze data about the performance and capacity of the network and its components. Assist IT security personnel in monitoring, reporting and auditing network enterprise. Develop, design and document standards and guidelines, and collaborate with other peers and architects on IT best practice solutions. Create and update detailed network and server infrastructure documentation Complete all responsibilities as outlined on annual Performance Plan. Complete all special projects and other duties as assigned. Must be able to perform duties with or without reasonable accommodation. LAN, WAN, DNS, VOIP, IP security, NAT, ACLs, STP, BGP, EIGRP, HSRP, OSFP, PPP, MPLS, VPN, SNMP Experience with security tools to include: Cisco VPN, RSA server and devices and anti-virus Broad knowledge of the configuration and maintenance of multiple vendor hardware using both GUI and CLI methods Knowledge of telephony such as PRIs, H.323, SIP, and basic call routing as to assist in troubleshooting. We partner closely with internal teams and customers to assure WEX operates in a secure and compliant manner. Our team holds itself to a high-standard and we collaborate closely with one another to ensure strong, reliable and effective relationships. From securing applications, data centers and cloud resources, we’ve got more work than we can handle and we’re looking for great people to come along for the ride. We are looking for a Senior Network Security Engineer is responsible for ensuring the secure function of software security and familiarity with multiple general security practices and toolsets Who are you? Culturally, you’re: A highly motivated network security engineer who loves working on small, high performing teams that interface with the entire enterprise A collaborative, solid communicator who works well with your team and stakeholders to drive projects from inception to completion Someone who cares deeply for team results but is able to work independently to deliver high quality solutions for projects and operational tasks Comfortable balancing the need to move fast with the realities of working in a highly regulated organization Someone who thrives in situations where details and accuracy are vital A skilled worker that has the motivation, expertise, and work ethic to operate independently across global time zones, and who is able to complete tasks and deliverables with minimal oversight Work closely with Enterprise IT teams on securing WEX's infrastructure and applications Able to mentor other engineers both technically and professionally Technically, you: Are a Subject Matter Expert in Network Security Engineer, implement, and monitor security measures to protect the enterprise Configure and troubleshoot network infrastructure devices Regularly review configurations and develop improvement plans Develop technical solutions and new security tools to help mitigate security findings, vulnerabilities, and risks Write comprehensive reports including assessment-based findings, outcomes and recommendations for security enhancement. Have a diverse background in IT, security and supporting processes Deep experience working with compliance and regulatory frameworks such as PCI-DSS, HIPAA/HITRUST, SOX, GDPR, NIST, etc. Comprehensive knowledge of networking concepts, applications, and technologies Ability to perform advanced troubleshooting on network traffic, network security infrastructure, and security incidents Experience with enterprise firewalls, Cloud WAF, and/or similar network security devices At a minimum, you Have 7+ years of experience in Enterprise Network Security Engineering Have 5+ years of broad experience with security technologies in an enterprise environment Experience working with Palo Alto firewalls Have a strong, practical understanding of modern cloud IT infrastructure, networking, and security engineering concepts Are able to troubleshoot network and security issues within a complex environment Have 5+ years of experience in engineering solutions which meet security, compliance, and business needs Can commit and deliver on very specific project/delivery timelines with minimal supervision Are able work in an on-call rotation which may include some night and weekend shifts Have excellent customer support skills, both written and verbal Have 5+ years of experience in supporting enterprise firewalls, proxy solutions, and other perimeter security devices Have 5+ years of experience with securing applications and enabling secure communication through HTTPS, DNSSec, and other applicable technologies Familiar with ITIL concepts, and are able to apply them to Incidents, Problems, and Changes. Are an expert in Security Policy management on network security devices It would be nice if you Have cloud experience with AWS and Azure Experience working with Imperva Cloud WAF Experience working with Splunk Experience working with Cisco ASA devices Hold advanced certifications relevant to network devices and Information Security (e.g. CCIE, CISSP, PCSE, etc) The base pay range represents the anticipated low and high end of the pay range for this position. Actual pay rates will vary and will be based on various factors, such as your qualifications, skills, competencies, and proficiency for the role. Base pay is one component of WEX's total compensation package. Most sales positions are eligible for commission under the terms of an applicable plan. Non-sales roles are typically eligible for a quarterly or annual bonus based on their role and applicable plan. WEX's comprehensive and market competitive benefits are designed to support your personal and professional well-being. Benefits include health, dental and vision insurances, retirement savings plan, paid time off, health savings account, flexible spending accounts, life insurance, disability insurance, tuition reimbursement, and more. For more information, check out the "About Us" section. Salary Pay Range: $117,000.00 - $156,000.00

Why Mayo Clinic Mayo Clinic is top-ranked in more specialties than any other care provider according to U.S. News & World Report. As we work together to put the needs of the patient first, we are also dedicated to our employees, investing in competitive compensation and comprehensive benefit plans – to take care of you and your family, now and in the future. And with continuing education and advancement opportunities at every turn, you can build a long, successful career with Mayo Clinic. You’ll thrive in an environment that supports innovation, is committed to ending racism and supporting diversity, equity and inclusion, and provides the resources you need to succeed. Responsibilities Primarily a remote work position, however, must live within driving distance of Arizona, Florida, or Rochester, MN Mayo Clinic campus for onsite expectations. The Telecom/Network Engineer will design, configure, manage, troubleshoot, support and implement the Telecom/Network Infrastructure. Will also perform limited project management with some coordination of efforts by various support staff. Communicates project status to project proponents. Under general supervision, participates in decisions on technical direction, architecture design, and product selection for the enterprise telecom/data network. Assists with the deployment of telecom/network technology. Exercises independent judgment. Under general direction works on complex technical issues. Provides input to short and long-term section strategy and budget planning. May be required to perform some of the duties of Telecom/Network Specialist. Receptive to new ideas and to learning new technologies. Plans and leads small projects and performs project management coordinating the efforts of internal and external staff with the customer and business needs. On occasion oversees projects and tasks assigned to project team members and may be asked to provide input to their evaluations. Occasionally works under stressful conditions, participating in implementations and troubleshooting efforts that may have significant patient care and/or financial impact to the organization. May be asked to represent Telecommunications and Networks to committees at Mayo. Networks team members in Network Operations maintain and support the enterprise networks. Network Engineers provide the highest level advanced services within Operations. This position will be targeted to provide services related to network level 3 support. The skills that will be sought will be advanced skills in troubleshooting and administration of Cisco LAN technologies, switching, routing, wireless, and remote access environments is desirable. This person will participate in our on call rotation providing 24x7 support for all infrastructures, will contribute significantly to enterprise network activities, represent Network Operations in business and practice activities and will provide an escalation point for activities requiring advanced skills. Preferred candidates would have advanced Cisco network infrastructure experience and have strong knowledge and experience supporting secure network infrastructure such as ISE and NAC. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline with a minimum of 2 years professional technical work experience or an Associate’s degree with a minimum of 4 years of professional technical work experience. A minimum of 6 years professional technical work experience required for individuals without a degree. Expert knowledge of telecom/network concepts and 7-layer OSI model is required. Knowledge of basic telecom/network management and monitoring tools. Basic understanding of desktop and server operating systems is desirable. Must be able to work with minimum direction and able to work effectively in a team environment. Must be customer focused and possess excellent communications and interpersonal skills to interact with a variety of personnel at various levels within and outside the institution. Good organizational and time management skills are required to handle the workload and track the various projects going on simultaneously. Solid analytical skills are also a necessity. Authorization to work and remain in the United States, without necessity for Mayo Clinic sponsorship now, or in the future (for example, be a U.S. Citizen, national, or permanent resident, refugee, or asylee). Also, Mayo Clinic does not participate in the F-1 STEM OPT extension program. Exemption Status Exempt Compensation Detail $74,817.60 - $115,502.40 / year Benefits Eligible Yes Schedule Full Time Hours/Pay Period 80 Schedule Details Monday - Friday; 8:00 am - 5:00 pm. Evening and weekend work as required by job duties; will participate in on-call rotation. Weekend Schedule As needed per job requirements. International Assignment No Site Description Just as our reputation has spread beyond our Minnesota roots, so have our locations. Today, our employees are located at our three major campuses in Phoenix/Scottsdale, Arizona, Jacksonville, Florida, Rochester, Minnesota, and at Mayo Clinic Health System campuses throughout Midwestern communities, and at our international locations. Each Mayo Clinic location is a special place where our employees thrive in both their work and personal lives. Learn more about what each unique Mayo Clinic campus has to offer, and where your best fit is. Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer As an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer Mayo Clinic is committed to creating an inclusive environment that values the diversity of its employees and does not discriminate against any employee or candidate. Women, minorities, veterans, people from the LGBTQ communities and people with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply to join our teams. Reasonable accommodations to access job openings or to apply for a job are available. Recruiter Miranda Grabner

The Trade Desk is a global technology company with a mission to create a better, more open internet for everyone through principled, intelligent advertising. Handling over 1 trillion queries per day, our platform operates at an unprecedented scale. We have also built something even stronger and more valuable: an award-winning culture based on trust, ownership, empathy, and collaboration. We value the unique experiences and perspectives that each person brings to The Trade Desk, and we are committed to fostering inclusive spaces where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work every day. Do you have a passion for solving hard problems at scale? Are you eager to join a dynamic, globally- connected team where your contributions will make a meaningful difference in building a better media ecosystem? Come and see why Fortune magazine consistently ranks The Trade Desk among the best small- to medium-sized workplaces globally. The Trade Desk Network Operation, Network Engineers work closely with the Network Reliability Engineering Team, the Data Center Engineering team, and various SRE teams to provide operational support at scale for the network that runs globally distributed systems. ABOUT THE ROLE: Support, troubleshoot, extend, and improve the network across physical datacenters and circuits, and multi-provider cloud environments. Support thousands of hosts worldwide with petabyte-scale data challenges. Participate in root-cause analysis and postmortem discussions to effectively drive long-term operational health improvements. Analyze process gaps and implement solutions to speed up execution and reduce manual toil. Participate in an on-call rotation. WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR: Skills and Experience Strong understanding of TCP/IP and the OSI model. Strong understanding of IP networks and the protocols needed to run large-scale networks. Experience troubleshooting complex network issues. Experience working in a DevOps environment, using network automation tools such as Ansible, Git and Python. Experience contributing to monitoring and alerting systems. Experience with cloud providers such as Amazon Web Services, Azure or Alibaba Cloud. Experience working with network operating systems such as Cumulus Linux, SONiC, Cisco IOS and Junos. Experience in or interest towards in platform engineering; daily usage of technologies such as Kubernetes and Docker, specifically around being able to plan and build infrastructure to support these types of applications and troubleshooting the networking components of them. Must be open to working in a hybrid work model Key Attributes: Technical Contributions: Experience building always-on networks, working across a variety of technologies and service layers. Uses a data driven approach to both daily time investments as well as long-term bets. Operationally Efficient: Operate in a way that reduces complexity and cuts operational risks with a solid grasp of costs and the return on investment - of time, implementation, customer impact. A track record of making significant and self-directed, contributions to large and impactful projects. Actively communicate with your team as well as across the organization to effectively drive toward a unified goal. Practical problem solving, superb communication and documentation skills. Collaboration skills are required to be successful in this role An Empathetic, Objective, Critical Thinker: Thinking beyond the task at hand to deeply understand the 'why' behind an objective. #LI-AD1 NY, CO, CA, and WA residents only: In accordance with NY, CO, CA, and WA law, the range provided is The Trade Desk's reasonable estimate of the base compensation for this role. The actual amount may differ based on non-discriminatory factors such as experience, knowledge, skills, abilities, and location. All employees may be eligible to become The Trade Desk shareholders through eligibility for stock-based compensation grants, which are awarded to employees based on company and individual performance. The Trade Desk also offers other compensation depending on the role such as sales-based incentives and commissions. Plus, expected benefits for this role include comprehensive healthcare (medical, dental, and vision) with premiums paid in full for employees and dependents, retirement benefits such as a 401k plan and company match, short and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance, well-being benefits, reimbursement for certain tuition expenses, parental leave, sick time of 1 hour per 30 hours worked, vacation time for full-time employees up to 120 hours thru the first year and 160 hours thereafter, and around 13 paid holidays per year. Employees can also purchase The Trade Desk stock at a discount through The Trade Desk's Employee Stock Purchase Plan. The Trade Desk also offers a competitive benefits package. Click here to learn more. Note: Interns are not eligible for variable incentive awards such as stock-based compensation, retirement plan, vacation, tuition reimbursement or parental leave At the Trade Desk, Base Salary is one part of our competitive total compensation and benefits package and is determined using a salary range. The base salary range for this role is $102,400—$187,700 USD

requirement: Job Summary Operate as part of a team of professionals that is responsible for the 24x7 availability of Geisinger's 30,000+ node, 150+ site converged voice & data network. Responsible for installation and ongoing maintenance of network equipment and the systems required to manage and maintain Geisinger’s network infrastructure. Deliver these IT services at agreed upon levels. Job Duties Physically installs, configures, upgrades, repairs and performs maintenance on network, IP telephony, and ancillary equipment and systems supporting the Geisinger Network. Demonstrates experience with standard procedures and methods to complete projects and work orders as assigned. Determine equipment and material requirements in conjunction with senior engineers / Architects Demonstrated experience in the Pulling, terminating and testing of copper cabling and fiber optics. Determines Infrastructure Change Management risk. Performs network device and system upgrades and patches within scope of responsibilities Participates in tier 1 / 2 / 3 upgrades and updates Responds and take ownership / assists with network incidents and tickets as assigned Demonstrated knowledge in the processes of verifying normal service after all scheduled repairs or upgrades. Demonstrated knowledge in troubleshooting and diagnosing errors in equipment. Demonstrate knowledge of network management tools, procedures, and methods to repair network equipment and systems. Demonstrated knowledge of transmission control protocol/internet protocol (TCP/IP), open systems interconnection (OSI) model, and optical networking. Demonstrated knowledge of network design, devices, network appliances, network architecture, protocols and network topology. Demonstrated knowledge of related industry specifications and standards for Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE), American National Standards Institute (ANSI), fiber, multi-mode, single-mode, unshielded twisted pair (UTP), bridging, switching, routing, Ethernet and transport technologies and protocols Demonstrated knowledge in one or more sub-specialties of Networking (I.e. Security/firewalling, voice/communications, wireless, Data Center infrastructure , cloud, etc.) Work is typically performed in an office environment. Accountable for satisfying all job specific obligations and complying with all organization policies and procedures. The specific statements in this profile are not intended to be all-inclusive. They represent typical elements considered necessary to successfully perform the job. Relevant experience may be a combination of related work experience and degree obtained (Associate’s Degree = 2 years; Bachelor’s Degree = 4 years). Position Details Education High School Diploma or Equivalent (GED)- (Required) Experience Minimum of 8 years-Relevant experience* (Required) Certification(s) and License(s) OUR PURPOSE & VALUES: Everything we do is about caring for our patients, our members, our students, our Geisinger family and our communities. KINDNESS: We strive to treat everyone as we would hope to be treated ourselves. EXCELLENCE: We treasure colleagues who humbly strive for excellence. LEARNING: We share our knowledge with the best and brightest to better prepare the caregivers for tomorrow. INNOVATION: We constantly seek new and better ways to care for our patients, our members, our community, and the nation. SAFETY: We provide a safe environment for our patients and members and the Geisinger family We offer healthcare benefits for full time and part time positions from day one, including vision, dental and domestic partners. Perhaps just as important, from senior management on down, we encourage an atmosphere of collaboration, cooperation and collegiality. We know that a diverse workforce with unique experiences and backgrounds makes our team stronger. Our patients, members and community come from a wide variety of backgrounds, and it takes a diverse workforce to make better health easier for all. We are proud to be an affirmative action, equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or status as a protected veteran.

The Network Engineer is onboard Naval Base Ventura County (NBVC) to provide technical support to the Dolus Program for Unmanned Surface Vessels (USV). The ideal candidate will have experience with research, development, test, evaluation, engineering, and maintenance within a U.S. Navy Surface Warfare environment. This is a mid-level position that will require periodic communications with senior level military and civilian personnel. Required to configure and troubleshoot Cisco Routers and Switches as required to support network operations within the vessel. Embarked network systems will include the Automated Digital Network System (ADNS) and the Consolidated Afloat Network Enterprise System (CANES) Interface required with Communications Systems to include UHF SATCOM Mobile Objective User System (MUOS), JMACS, Intellian Antennas, Commercial Broadband Satellite Program (CBSP) MIDS/JTRS (Link-16). Will be required to use/input crypto key mat as required for classified system operation Assist in conducting test and experiment events, collecting data, analyzing information, and reporting results. May be required to get underway with the vessels to support testing and maintenance efforts as they occur. Assist in the creation, performance, and analysis of test events for a variety of applications for routine military operations. Coordinate with technical personnel from Naval Information Warfare Command (NIWC) and various US Navy Systems Commands on related projects to plan, brief, conduct, and debrief tests and experiments. Provide regular technical status reporting to US Government engineers and senior military personnel. REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE: B.S. or B.A. in a Technology related field desired but not required. Strong communications skills required. Ability and usage of all Microsoft (MS365) products required. Must be able to brief and report daily as testing evolutions progress. Applicable experience with maintenance operations and related CONUS and OCONUS military and civilian operations is desirable. Ability to create and maintain test documents is desirable. Understanding roles of and interactions between higher echelon Navy commands is desirable. Position involves remote work from home, as well as underway time when required for event execution. Travel Required: 10-25%. U.S. Citizenship status required Must have an active DoD Secret Security Clearance or be able to obtain or reestablish this level of clearance. Senior UI/UX Designer, Web Applications A little about us. Splunk is here to build a safer and more resilient digital world. We’re proud to say that we’re the key to enterprise resilience for more than 11,000 enterprise organizations that use our Unified Security and Observability Platform to keep their systems secure and reliable. We’re also proud of our award-winning culture and our regular appearance on those “Best Places to Work” lists. If you end up joining us, we’ll only ask one thing: bring your whole, authentic self, what we call your million data points. So bring your work experience, problem-solving skills and talent, of course, but also bring your joy, your passion and all the things that make you, you. Because when you feel free to be you, it makes it a lot easier for us to be us. Job Description: As a Senior UX/UI Designer, within the IT Engineering department, you'll be involved in the full life-cycle of design for a portfolio of internal custom applications used across a diverse line of business, such as sales, marketing, customer success, human resources, recruiting, and products, to run our $2B+ and growing business. You’ll partner with product managers and engineers to deliver great experiences, as well as compelling user interfaces to both external and internal users, enabling them through phenomenal user experiences. We’re looking for thinkers and innovators who are willing to challenge the status quo and are energized by developing creative solutions to complex problems. In addition, great oral communication and written documentation skills are valuable for this role in promoting ideas throughout the company. What you'll do: Yeah, I want to and can do that. Work closely with product managers and engineering teams, to deliver best-in-class user experiences and compelling visual designs for a diverse portfolio of internal and external applications Perform usability studies to challenge established thinking and discover new ways of solving problems Develop user workflow diagrams, storyboards, prototypes, and wireframes Develop compelling visual designs for products that excite end-users and create brand awareness Present designs and effectively communicate design rationale to diverse stakeholders Partner with teams to define product roadmaps and prioritize requirements for releases Create detailed design specifications and design standards for enterprise IT applications Drive design in accord with principles of user-centered design Ensure projects fulfill business requirements, goals, and delight end-users Requirements: I’ve already done that or have that! 7+ years of combined experience in user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design 5+ years of experience designing for single-page web applications 5+ year of experience designing for mobile applications Expertise in the capabilities of CSS and Javascript Experience working on cross-browser, multi-device applications. Expertise in data visualization and information architecture Expertise in using industry-standard design and prototyping tools, such as Sketch, Figma, Adobe CC Expertise creating prototypes to communicate design concepts to users and project partners Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal Experience in a fast-paced, iterative development environment Preferred knowledge and experience: These are a huge plus. Experience delivering in an Agile environment Experience directing creative across multiple designers a strong plus Education: Got it! BS or MS in Visual Design or equivalent experience required What We Offer You: If you’d like to join one of the fastest-growing and most exciting tech companies in Silicon Valley, contact us! Above Lending is a next-generation financial services company. We provide simple and transparent products aimed at helping our clients achieve their personal finance goals. With competitive rates and personalized support, our mission is to simplify the lending process and help borrowers attain financial well-being. We are committed to making credit more affordable and accessible. About the Role Above Lending is looking for a UX/UI Designer who advocates for our customers utilizing research and interaction design skills to optimize applications and improve ease of use to create the best possible user experience. The Designer will utilize industry standards, competitor research, user testing, performance data, wireframes and prototypes to communicate and sell ideas. They work as part of the Product team making a positive impact on the way customers experience Above Lending. As a Designer at Above, you will see projects through their full life cycle from research to the post-release phase, including QA. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, partnering with Product and Engineering, and pitching to stakeholders along the way. You will leverage analytics tools and techniques to support decision-making and prioritization, and to measure success. You will maintain a library of usability templates, guidelines, best practices, research documentation, and raw data. The ideal candidate is passionate about learning, testing, executing, analyzing and optimizing our customer experience to grow and drive the business forward. We are looking for someone who’s eager to work in a close-knit, collaborative environment and at the same time can take real ownership of their own projects and responsibilities. You will: Create and maintain wireframe systems, user flows, prototypes, specifications, navigation maps and user research findings Partner and collaborate with designers, coders, copywriters, and product managers to develop compelling and creative solutions Collaborate with marketing and operations teams to create new HTML emails. Iterate upon existing email content. Devise customer-centric, effective UX solutions for web and mobile applications Collaborating with engineering and product teams to understand technical considerations and communicate them to non-technical stakeholders Experience with an iterative testing approach that requires a rapid design, build, and measurement cycle Flexibility and adaptability to rework your designs based on legal, product, marketing, engineering and other stakeholder feedback You have: Bachelor’s Degree in HCI, Computer Science, Design or related discipline 5+ years of experience practicing UX Design at a technology or e-commerce company Wire-framing and prototyping experience with tools like Adobe XD, Sketch, Figma, etc. Ability to prototype and strong understanding of HTML/CSS, JavaScript, modern front-end JavaScript frameworks Excellent analytical skills; solid understanding of experiment design, measurement, and analysis (i.e. A/B testing) and the ability to make recommendations supported by data A proactive self-starter who enjoys and thrives working in a fast-paced environment Ability to meet deadlines, manage multiple projects, and remain flexible as priorities change Strong organizational skills and attention to detail Creative thinker with excellent communication skills What we offer: Health, dental and vision insurance Competitive base pay Bonus opportunities Flexible personal time-off 401(K) match More importantly, our team spirit and culture are what really sets us apart as a company. We’re a world-class company that loves what we do…and we have fun doing it! Join our dynamic team and contribute to Above Lending’s success as we continue to provide innovative lending solutions to our customers. Our Austin-based Product Design (UX/UI) team is looking for an Austin-based Principal Product Designer to join their team. This individual will be expected to work out of our Downtown Austin HQ. We are following a hybrid office/work from home model (three days per week in-office/two days work from home). Note: To be considered, you must provide a link to an online portfolio (please include password). Summary: As a Product Design leader, you will provide direction, and mentorship for a team of Product Designers for both consumer-facing products, as well as internal, enterprise products. As leader, you will help to cultivate creative culture, guide high-impact design work, and lead a team of talented multidisciplinary designers with a focus on broader operational results. The role is perfect for someone with a passion for human-centered design, deep empathy and who can motivate and inspire a collaborative group of UX thinkers. Responsibilities: Provides day-to-day guidance and leadership for UX/UI Design Team Members. Oversees the creation of team member's individual goals to align with department goals and defines success outcomes. Encourages innovation and curiosity. Leads by example by bringing ideas to the table and encouraging team discussions. Rewards enthusiasm for solving business and user challenges. Work closely with designers, researchers, product managers, developers, brand, and leadership to develop a shared understanding of the user experience within the team. Oversees the full range of UX/UI Design activity, including: Providing UX/UI analysis, design, and development services across new and ongoing initiatives, platforms, and delivery channels, Delivering creative concepts to bring the WFM brand to life across platforms, apps, web, and other channels, Developing / communicating app and site structure and user paths. Ensures ‘ideal’ projects are balanced against technical constraints, business objectives, and operational processes. Engages with designers, developers, and other stakeholders to ensure effective integration with and support of team initiatives and associated activity. Engages with users on a regular basis to ensure understanding of expectations, experience, issues, and concerns. Leads team efforts to evaluate consumer, demographic, and other data to understand design principles, applications, and results. Be an internal and external thought leader that manages and provides support to direct reports in design methodologies, extending the team’s influence on design strategy and solutions. Establish and own team goals, applying an understanding of potential challenges to provide effective support. Leads functional continuous process improvement by recommending enhancements and identifying new tools and technologies. Evangelize the strength of design-thinking and demonstrate how its application across workstreams provides common ground among teams through a shared vocabulary, production of tangible artifacts, and the building of a trust-based team culture. Mentors junior to mid-level designers within Whole Foods Market and outside in the larger design community. Motivate and lead the UX Product Team by promoting innovation, exploration, high performance, and a strong sense of urgency as well as ongoing education and learning. Skills: Leverages business understanding and experience to effectively prioritize team and project activity. Facilitates Team Member training, development, and career management efforts. Works with key internal and external stakeholders to ensure shared understanding of priorities, objectives, and anticipated outcomes. Demonstrates active and empathetic listening skills. Ensures data-based insights are shared with the appropriate decision-makers. Able to present complex / multi-faceted analyses to key stakeholders in a clear and concise format. Contributes to analytical strategy development and ensures appropriate team focus and alignment. Integrates internal and external stakeholder information and perspective in task and project management. Maintains open communication among all task / project stakeholders, internal and external. Monitors outcomes and incorporates lessons learned into future task / project activity. Demonstrates understanding of industry, market, and company dynamics and business drivers. Demonstrates understanding of partner and competitor dynamics and business drivers. Education & Experience: BA/BS or Masters Degree in User Experience Design, Graphic Design, Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Fine Art, Psychology, or a related discipline. 2-5 years of leadership experience and 5-10 years experience in the industry, OR equivalent combination of education and relevant experience. Preference goes to those who have: Experience leading a diverse team in the delivery of experiences from end to end (user flows, wireframes, high-fidelity visuals) as well as tools skilled with Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, and expertise in planning and building design roadmaps that align to larger, organizational goals. Experience working within diverse, dynamic, cross-functional teams. You love working with others and don't mind trial and error. A bias for action to build consensus within the team, seeking out and encouraging the exchange of constructive feedback. At Whole Foods Market, we provide a fair and equal employment opportunity for all Team Members and candidates regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, marital status, disability, or any other legally protected characteristic. Whole Foods Market hires and promotes individuals solely based on qualifications for the position to be filled and business needs. Whole Foods Market works with job sites like Indeed, LinkedIn, and ZipRecruiter to promote opportunities at our company. Please be aware that other career sites may not be accurate or up to date and may even be fraudulent. We encourage and recommend all candidates to apply via our site.

Position Summary: RT Specialty is seeking a UX/UI Designer to help execute user-friendly design for our digital products. The ideal candidate will be required to produce innovative solutions for our product designs making them practical yet straightforward to use. The UX/UI Designer will improve the efficiency of the product and help increase customer experience and satisfaction and profits of our company. Learning how to organize, multitask and manage time to complete tasks. Hands on experience with wireframes, storyboards, and sitemaps. Learn on the job regarding the best practices in user interface and designing. Exposure to the design industry and its various responsibilities. Excellent knowledge of visual design and wireframing tools like Photoshop, Illustrator, etc. Excellent communication and presentation skills. Great visual design, time management and multitasking skills. Good problem-solving ability with attention to detail. Well-read on the new technology and best practices in the market. Experience working on large-scale software projects within an agile environment A combination of relevant experience and education may be considered Disclaimer Ryan Specialty is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Job Description ?What's in it for you?! Join a rapidly growing, global team on a mission to revolutionize financial products across legacy industries by leveraging data and cutting-edge technology. Competitive compensation package and generous equity options. Flexible PTO (Unlimited vacation, paid holidays, and paid sick days). Medical, vision, and dental insurance. Manager Update: Salary is $120 - $140 depending on experience. If the candidate has extensive experience that requires a higher salary, they are negotiable. Someone local to Houson that can come in the office as needed with at least 6 years of experience. Stockpile is a user-friendly investment app designed to empower families in building a secure financial future through collaborative, hands-on investing, and money management experiences. Our platform simplifies investing in stocks, making it accessible for both parents and children to learn and grow their wealth together. Children can learn by doing, making their own trades with adult approval, fostering financial literacy and independence. With a diverse selection of well-known stocks, Stockpile offers investment opportunities to suit families’ interests and goals. We are based in SF Bay Area and Los Angeles. You have experience developing best practices, libraries, and style guides. Experience designing apps with 100K+ users. Maintain up-to-date knowledge of current industry trends and market conditions. Competitive salary depending on experience, education and location. We help children of all backgrounds, even in the most dangerous places, inspired by our Christian faith. 01 The Job At World Vision USA we invite people to positively impact the lives of the world's most vulnerable children through charitable giving. Our recipe includes love of all people, thriftiness, and targeting the root causes of poverty to bring about human transformation and fullness of life. With us every 60 seconds a family gets water, a hungry child is fed, and a family gets the tools to overcome poverty. As Senior Product Designer (UX/UI), your expertise will be brought to bear on work that is close to the heart of God (in the spirit of Matthew 25:34-40). Look no further to connect your passion to life-changing work with impact by crafting digital experiences that align with our Christian organization’s mission, values, and strategic vision. By weaving the art of storytelling and deep product design insight, you'll captivate and retain users, ultimately driving long-term donor loyalty. Imagine joining a team where your creativity and design skills are not just valued but celebrated. You'll be part of an organization that is deeply committed to its mission and eager to see your talents shine. If you're ready to be the driving force behind user-centered digital products and make a meaningful impact, seize this opportunity and pursue joining our team at World Vision. Your journey toward purpose-driven innovation awaits. You will be joining a team that flipped the script on child sponsorship with the introduction of Chosen®, recognized by AdWeek, MediaPost, Upworthy, Christianity Today and winner of two 2020 ANA REGGIE Awards. We're honored to say World Vision USA has earned a 4-star rating (out of 4) with Charity Navigator as well as having received GuideStar's Platinum Seal of Transparency. At World Vision our ultimate God-sized dream is to see more children, families, and communities affected by poverty experience the fullness of life that God intends for them all for his glory. Do you share this dream with us and so many others? We hope so. Your responsibilities will include: Keep Christ central in individual and corporate life. Actively participate in and contribute to the spiritual disciplines of the organization (Christian conduct, devotions, chapel, prayer, worship); incorporate our core values into decisions within the scope of the role. Product-Centric Approach: Incorporate a deep comprehension of product design, user needs, business goals, and technical constraints into all designs. User Interface & Interaction Design: Create content diagrams, content maps, wireframes, comprehensive user flow, and both low and high-fidelity prototypes. Responsive Design: Deliver responsive designs (desktop, mobile, tablet) in collaboration with the Digital Experience Team. Design Frameworks: Employ current methodologies, including Design Thinking and Jobs to be Done, to deliver comprehensive design solutions. Design Systems Management: Develop, maintain, and evolve a comprehensive design system, ensuring consistency across all digital products. Collaborate with stakeholders, front-end developers, and other designers to ensure that the design system is up-to-date, relevant, and effectively meets the needs of users and the business. Drive the adoption and adherence of the design system guidelines, promoting a consistent and cohesive user experience across all touchpoints. Research: Stay updated on the latest industry UX/UI trends, competitor strategies, and emergent interactive technologies. Collaboration: Work closely with product managers, developers, and other stakeholders throughout the product development cycle to ensure a seamless and coherent user experience. Meetings: Participate in key internal meetings including client discovery meetings to understand business goals and objectives. Project Tracking: Document ongoing progress and status on work assignments in agency project management software and communicate updates during daily stand-ups. Development Liaison: Work closely with front-end developers to ensure UX/UI and product design standards are met. Storytelling: Use the art of storytelling to effectively communicate design decisions, user journeys, and the holistic vision of the product to stakeholders, ensuring buy-in and a shared understanding of the product's purpose and direction Data-Driven Design: Implement data-driven interface design methods based on user and UX research. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Engage with a cross-functional team to align visual strategy with UX, content marketing, and brand strategy. Mentorship: May mentor and provide direction to emerging digital designers, imparting a product-centric approach. 02 What success looks like Deliver exceptional design: Create and execute elevated concepts that align with the World Vision’s mission, vision, and objectives, ensuring consistently intuitive and delightful user experiences across all products. Foster innovation and design thinking: Champion a culture of innovation and design thinking within the team by regularly introducing new design concepts, methodologies, and tools to drive product excellence. Drive user engagement and retention: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to improve user engagement and retention rates by designing intuitive, user-centered digital experiences that meet or exceed defined KPIs. Enhance cross-functional collaboration: Collaborate effectively with product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to streamline the product creation process, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality designs. Continuous improvement and user feedback: Work with design research to facilitate a robust feedback loop by gathering and analyzing user feedback, conducting usability tests, and iterating on designs to continuously improve the user experience and meet organization OKR targets. 03 You Bring Bachelor’s degree in design, digital art, interaction design, product design, or a related field (or 8 years of equivalent work experience). Additionally, this role requires a minimum of 6-8 years of experience in the digital creative field. Your experience must include a minimum of 5 years of hands-on experience as a key interaction/visual designer within a product design and UX/UI Proven expertise in the development and management of design systems, with specific experience in modern design software. Demonstrable experience with storytelling techniques to effectively communicate and promote design ideas. Familiarity with frameworks such as Design Thinking and Jobs to be Done (JTBD), and the ability to adapt to evolving workflow philosophies. Proficient in responsive/mobile design principles and best practices. Extensive knowledge of layout principles, typography, and design best practices for both web and mobile platforms. Expertise in a variety of digital design software and prototyping tools. 04 Additional skills we're interested Prefer agency experience (in-house or external). Knowledge of how CSS and HTML work as it relates to how things are built by developers and come to life. Motion design skills are a plus. 05 Salary Range & Benefits Your compensation and benefits are important to you so they’re important to us. $82,632.63 - $131,997.59. Applies to locations with a market similar to our U.S. HQ in the Greater Seattle area. A different range may apply based on your work location. The typical hiring range is $100,000 - $112,000.Job offers within the range are based on relevant job qualifications and pay equity. World Vision employees see our Salary Administration Guidelines and My Life My Benefits pages on our organization intranet known as The Vine. Please indicate the range you're targeting when asked during the application process. In addition, we have a robust and comprehensive benefits package to round out our total compensation package. Click here to learn more (this position is a grade 226). Additionally, merit, auto allowance, and relocation are available to eligible employees based on existing plans. 06 Where this job could take your career World Vision U.S. is a part of the larger World Vision International partnership. Globally, we have 34,000+ staff working in nearly 100 countries. More than 1000 of us call World Vision U.S. home. You'll have opportunities to advance within our robust and talented group of professionals as you continue to stretch and grow your career for the future. 07 About World Vision U.S. When you work at World Vision, your passions and talents come together to help meet the greatest needs in the world today. We tackle poverty at its roots, with a focus on helping the most vulnerable children overcome poverty and experience the fullness of life. Our staff around the world are committed to demonstrating God’s unconditional love for all people by serving every child we can, of any faith or none. And we are one of the world’s most trusted charities, with more than 70 years of experience working alongside communities, donors, partners, and governments to create opportunities for better futures for vulnerable children ... even in the toughest places. Are you feeling called to explore joining us? 08 Let your work be your faith in action In 2021 an estimated 5 million children under the age of 5 years died, mostly from preventable and treatable causes (USAID, WHO). That’s why we’re looking for someone who is ready to place their expertise behind helping the world’s most vulnerable children experience life in all its fullness. As a marketer and innovator at World Vision, your work will help create new, dignity-affirming experiences for donors, drawing them closer to God’s heart for children living in some of the hardest contexts in the world. Every prototype, every pattern, every pixel can help influence whether someone chooses to help today or not. If not you, then who? 09 To Apply Press the appropriate button on this page. 10 What happens next? Glad you asked. We owe you that and strive to not leave you wondering. We review applications nearly every day assessing the strength of fit for the role. Sometimes questions arise on our end, so we message you to learn more. Short-listed candidates are contacted for an initial conversation with our recruiting staff. Moving deeper into our selection process you can expect to interview 1:1 with a hiring manager. Finalists normally participate in a panel interview where the opportunity to meet additional members of our staff lends itself to a 360-degree view of the role. Our most valuable resource is our talented staff. Our goal is to fill this vacancy with the right person in the shortest amount of time, so we have all hands on-deck to move this important work forward.

Tempur Sealyis committed to improving the sleep of more people, every night, all around the world. Our highly recognized brands include Tempur-Pedic®, Sealy® and Stearns & Foster®. We hire people who have a passion for helping others find their best night's sleep. No matter what stage of your career, you can build your future at Tempur Sealy! OUR COMPANY OFFERS GREAT BENEFITS, INCLUDING: Generous Paid Time Off Competitive Medical, Dental & other wellness programs Disability and Life Company Paid Retirement Plan Options Generous Employee Purchase Discounts Pay Range: $63,000-$92,000 What You'll Do (Essential Duties and Responsibilities): Make a profound impact on the visual quality and user experience of our digital products, reaching millions of users globally. Revise and iterate designs and documentation based on continued user testing and feedback. Spur innovative ideas through expert-level knowledge of competitive and complimentary mobile and multi-platform products Understand the needs of all stakeholders to create intuitive and efficient designs. Confidence working on complex mobile/web applications with consumer-focused product UX. A strong portfolio highlighting a broad range of UX/UI-focused projects. Strong organizational skills Facilitate the client’s product vision by researching, conceiving, sketching, prototyping, and user-testing experiences for digital products Nice-Haves: 2-3 years of experience in the design field Experience in UX/UI Design Ability to identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. responsiveness) User testing experience Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, Job Description K12 is currently seeking a Senior UX/UI Designer to design consumer facing websites, landing page and apps. We are looking for someone with experience building large scale projects involving high content properties and can give visual clarity to large commerce sites with UX complexities. You will be responsible for brainstorming creative concepts with marketing stakeholders, developing original design concepts, executing designs based on established style guides, participating in visual design presentations to stakeholder, and developing design specs for programming and development. Over 20 years ago, Stride was founded to provide personalized learning — powered by technology. We reached students where they were in their own journeys. We knocked down their barriers to great education. And we gave every learner equal opportunity to succeed — however they defined success. Stride innovated the learning experience with online and blended learning that prepared them for their lives ahead. Stride is a community of passionate leaders. Whether teachers, engineers, curriculum writers, or financial managers — whatever your expertise or role, we all work to empower futures through learning. And changing the trajectory of learning itself is one of our greatest missions. Join us in developing more effective ways to learn and helping learners build the skills and confidence they need to make their way forward in life. K12 is currently seeking a Senior UX/UI Designer to design consumer facing websites, landing page and apps. We are looking for someone with experience building large scale projects involving high content properties and can give visual clarity to large commerce sites with UX complexities. Remote Work Type: Fixed Term Contract About the Company Change the future of dementia care with Tembo Health. We’re aiming to make managing dementia and senior health easier through tailored services and innovative technology. Many PCPs don’t feel positioned to provide dementia care and families are left not knowing where to turn or feel unsupported. Making matters worse, dementia families can see medical costs, hospitalizations, and ER visits increase exponentially over time. With our innovative dementia care management solution, we empower patients, caregivers, primary care physicians, and health plans to navigate the complexities and burden of dementia care. Together, let's create a brighter and easier future for senior care. We're venture backed, with funding from big tech investors like Bloomberg Beta, B Capital, Resolute, AARP and led by a cadre of entrepreneurs who have built and scaled unicorn tech companies (e.g., Flatiron, Oscar, Imagen). Our team includes startup veterans, physicians, and more. We're here to make a big, meaningful impact on healthcare and have fun while we're at it. We're looking for smart, mission-driven, goal-oriented team members who are creative problem solvers and big dreamers. If that sounds like you, let's talk! Our Values and Culture At Tembo, we're on a big mission: improve health outcomes for seniors. To make this mission a reality, we value several things in how we work: Patients First. We're here to make the lives of patients better and every activity has this in mind. Great Ideas. It doesn't matter whose idea it is, if it's a great idea, let's do it! Get Stuff Done. Ideas are nothing without implementation. So go ahead and try things, break stuff, learn and improve. In line with our values, we look for people who are Customer-Focused. You are able to identify and work towards what customers want and need. You see customer satisfaction as tantamount to success. Smart and Curious / Solution Oriented. You're constantly learning and applying your knowledge to find innovative solutions. You love sharing your ideas and workshopping ideas to get to great answers. You're excited by the prospect of iterating on products and processes to make them better over time. Efficient & Effective / Good at Time Management. You know what it takes to accomplish your goal and aren't afraid to put in the work. More importantly, you know how to ruthlessly prioritize and focus on the important activities. Our team features a wide breadth of experience in various industries and functions. This means we're bringing different ideas to the table that yield lively discussions and creative solutions that couldn't happen with industry experts alone. About the Role We are seeking a highly creative and detail-oriented UI/UX Designer to join our dynamic team on a contract basis. This role requires a unique blend of passion for user-centered design, a deep understanding of user experience, and a keen eye for detail. The ideal candidate will be an innovative thinker who actively seeks to understand customer needs and enjoys iterating their designs through user feedback. This is a part-time, contract role for about 3 months with opportunities to extend. Key Responsibilities: Lead design for native app and adaptive web features across mobile, desktop, and tablet to ensure an optimal user experience. Create iterative design documentation including user journey flows, wireframes, visual designs, prototypes, and detailed specifications of behaviors and design implementation. Conduct user research (from usability studies, surveys, interviews, etc.) and usability testing to gather feedback, generate usage metrics, understand user needs, and inform design choices. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, product management, and marketing, to create seamless and effective designs. Consider technical constraints and opportunities, working closely with engineers to guide designs from concept to implementation. Help implement and maintain Tembo Health’s design system Take full ownership of projects, from concept through to execution, ensuring high-quality outcomes. Stay abreast of UI/UX trends and best practices, applying them to improve our products and processes. Travel Requirements: We expect this role to potentially have up to 10% of travel for team meetings as well as user research and stakeholder engagement with our community customers and partners. About You Requirements: You’ll be a fit for this role if you have: 3+ years of proven experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role. A portfolio that demonstrates a human-centered design approach and problem-solving skills. Proficiency in design software (e.g., Figma, Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite, etc.). Experience with user research and usability testing. Strong collaboration skills and experience working with cross-functional teams. Excellent communication and presentation skills. Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Bonus qualifications: Experience with designing with accessibility and seniors in mind Experience in healthcare UX/UI design

UI/UX Designer, Openings Studio Location: Phoenix, AZ Join us on a journey to redefine the user experience landscape in ASSA ABLOY! As a UI/UX Designer for Global BIM Technologies, you’ll be at the forefront of our mission to revolutionize how users interact with technology. requirement: TSPi Position Description – Tester – Junior TSPi is a dependable and trusted IT solutions provider. Using our technological expertise and industry specific knowledge, we offer our clients end-to-end solutions to their mission challenges. We are looking for a Tester to provide support to our government clients. Position Title: Tester – Junior Years of Experience: 2+ Work Location: Remote Clearance Required: Public Trust Degree: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent job-related experience As a Tester at TSPi, you will play a vital role in our software testing team, responsible for ensuring the quality and reliability of our products. This entry-level position offers an excellent opportunity for individuals with a keen eye for detail and a passion for software testing. You will work closely with senior testers and developers, executing manual test cases, identifying defects, and providing valuable feedback to enhance our software solutions. Key Responsibilities: Test Execution: Execute manual test cases based on test plans and project requirements, identifying and documenting defects and anomalies. Defect Reporting: Log and track defects using designated tools, providing clear and concise steps to reproduce issues for developers. Test Documentation: Catalog and maintain test scenario library, keep the Team apprised of test results through automated and dashboard-style reporting using Selenium, Ready API, Jira, and Confluence Test Environment Setup: Assist in setting up and configuring test environments for various projects, ensuring they mirror the production environment as closely as possible. Regression Testing: Participate in regression testing to validate bug fixes and ensure that previously working functionalities remain unaffected. Test Strategy: Collaborate with senior testers and team leads to understand test requirements and contribute to the development of test strategies. Continuous Improvement: Suggest process improvements, identify opportunities to streamline testing activities, and adopt industry best practices. Communication: Effectively communicate testing progress, results, and concerns with team members and project stakeholders. Quality Assurance: Contribute to maintaining and enhancing the overall quality assurance process to deliver high-quality software products. Required Skills: Candidates applying for this role should possess the following qualifications and skills: Attention to Detail: Meticulous attention to detail to accurately identify defects and ensure comprehensive test coverage. Analytical Skills: Strong analytical abilities to understand project requirements, identify potential risks, and devise effective test cases. Test Methodologies: Familiarity with software testing methodologies and best practices for manual testing. Test Documentation: Proficiency in creating and maintaining test documentation, such as test cases and test scripts. Bug Tracking: Basic knowledge of bug tracking tools and systems to log and manage defects. Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively communicate test results and collaborate with team members. Adaptability: Ability to adapt quickly to changing project requirements and priorities. Additional Preferred Skills: Candidates with the following skills and experience will be given preference: Test Automation: Basic understanding of test automation concepts and tools (e.g., Selenium). Software Development Fundamentals: Knowledge of software development processes and programming languages. Agile Methodology: Exposure to Agile development methodologies and experience working in Agile teams. Software Deconstruction Engineer (aka Penetration Tester aka Infosec Consultant) We are back in hiring mode to staff up our team in response to strong account growth in 2023 and to meet our 2024 plans. The process starts with a technical puzzle that should take around an hour and will give you an idea of exactly what we mean by software deconstruction. Got questions? You’ll get a short intro call right after the puzzle. This is the best place to raise any questions you might have. Thanks …the ivision Assessment Team. What’s the job? You will work on information security projects for our clients. We test security of software and hardware systems. Understanding how systems are built and learning how to break them. Working with our experienced team on short-to-medium term engagements. This is a full-time job working for the ivision Assessment Team (https://research.ivision.com). We are titled as “consultants” but the position being offered is a traditional permanent hire. What would you do? Every two to three weeks you’ll get a new project to work on. A typical project will involve: Recon: Digging into the functionality, design, and implementation of the software system or device. Probing: Searching for implementation weaknesses which could indicate a security issue. This is a combination of tools that we use, tools that we build, and manual probing. For device projects this can include firmware extraction, analysis, and hardware interfacing. Extending: Now that you’ve found a weakness… how far can you extend your access into the system? Writing: Now that you’ve hacked your way in you’ll need to write-up your findings and work with the developers to make sure they understand what the problem is and how to fix it. If you enjoy puzzles and technical variety you’ll find this job very enjoyable. Who are we looking for? You do not need to have information security experience. If you’ve got the right technical background and problem solving skills we can train you in the dark arts of infosec. People who enjoy writing code, solving problems with code, and learning how computers work at a fundamental level. This is not a “travel every week” type of consultant. We do sometimes work at a client site but most of the time we do our projects remotely. We’re hiring for all experience levels: from zero career experience to information security veterans. Skills & Requirements Deep experience in software and computers. You may have earned this experience with a degree, career as a software developer, or perhaps you’ve invested in a technical hobby that took you deep into the rabbit hole. Technical writing skills (English) Resident of the USA and able to be employed in the USA. We encourage remote candidates to apply if they are residents of the USA. Some History Carve Systems was a boutique information security consulting firm. We were acquired by ivision in 2021 and now form the ivision Assessment Team. ivision is a managed services and consulting provider headquartered in Atlanta, with offices in Denver and Pittsburg. The former Carve team does all the same things that we used to do, except now we get to work with ivision’s customers and collaborate with other ivision teams to provide deeper remediation advice and services. Our combined Carve Systems and ivision research content is now showcased at https://research.ivision.com (new and growing!).
